storyInfo: The Nachzehrer King makes a final stand at the Palace of Westhaleg. He lets the Doctor's group through to Theresis, and enjoys his last war alone.

attributes.text: Can you hear Victoria cry, o kings of yore?
Fires burn my mother's skin...
I fly above her head, but do not hear her cry for help.
Only lament.
But who does she lament for—

attributes.content: Don't bother collecting the bodies of the Steam Knights and mercenaries. The Victorians already built this tomb for them.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I know, Ines, but...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Paprika clenches the blood-stained piece of paper in her hand and tries to imagine what it felt like as the Steam Knight wrote these words.
This is the Steam Knights' home, but the Sarkaz shouldn't be left here.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: If Hoederer can really bring everyone back to Kazdel with the Lifebone, can we take them with us too?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: If you've already made up your mind, then go ahead.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: But are you sure about this, Paprika? You aren't from Kazdel.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I—I can always find a way back to Columbia if I need to—
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: It's safer to travel back with the group for now.
Who knows what they'd do to you if you stayed in Victoria, or tried to head back to Columbia now?
attributes.name: Hoederer
Hoederer
attributes.content: Given the circumstances—

attributes.name: Hoederer
attributes.content: Ngh!
Stop pretending you're not injured.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I won't die. I can't die. Besides, we're already taking too long.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: How is the Lifebone's recovery going?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: It'll make it to Kazdel... provided no one 'accidentally' damages it again.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Oh, was that meant for me?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Guess YOUR recovery's going just fine.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: How are things looking outside, W?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I'll let you off the hook about the name this time, Ines.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Even better. How are things looking outside, W?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: The Victorians made a big push right after the fire on the walls. The Nachzehrer lines collapsed right away.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: What about the Nachzehrer King?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Still kicking, but he retreated into the city—
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I—Is there any news about the General, Miss Wiš'adel?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: Nope. Could be dead for all I know.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Manfred wouldn't die so easily.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But the chaos outside is a problem.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Based on intel my guys collected, Nezzsalem is still sitting cozy, even though the Military Commission screwed this battle up big time.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: And while I'd love to blow Theresis to smithereens, I gotta admit...
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: He's a cunning enough bastard that there's no way his forces would back down that easy.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I'm thinking your plan needs to be moved up, Hoederer.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: The Lifebone is ready.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Whatever the Regent is scheming, we should prepare to leave with the ones who've been dragged into this mess... before the Sarkaz purge begins.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I doubt the Victorians would let them go so easily.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I know, but...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Since when did we need the Victorians' permission to do anything?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I've got an idea.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: But first, we'll need to capture the Commission's command center. Say, in the name of Babel.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: You guys just wait here for my orders—
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: An idea isn't a plan, W, but you seem confident.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Fine, let's go. I've spent enough time underground.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Er, doesn't Hoederer need someone to take care of him?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I have it on good authority that he won't die.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: ...Yes, that's what I said.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Whatever the Regent and Nachzehrer are planning at the Palace of Westhaleg, the fate of the survivors is probably not their priority.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We can't just sit back and watch. You can tell us about your idea on the way.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hmph. Two dunces.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: What about you, Yarnball?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I'll go with you! The General might be at the command center. I have so much to ask him!
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: But do we just leave the Lifebone here?
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: I could blow it to pieces if you want. If you're volunteering to carry everyone on your back instead.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: It's WIŠ'ADEL!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Don't worry, Yarnball, no one'll ever guess it's here. And if anyone dares get close, my guys will take care of them.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Wiš'adel surveys the resting place of kings, now barely-recognizable rubble.
Besides, what better place to hide a pile of bones than a graveyard?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: <p=1>Outside the Military Commission Command Center</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Found a way in yet?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: The ducal alliance's army is surrounding the place, but they don't seem to have any intention of attacking.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What are they doing, then? Out for a picnic?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Defending this place was so important to the General. How could...
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: The General? You mean that devil by the name of Manfred? I'm afraid he fled with his tail between his legs, abandoning all of you.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Her Grace was right. The Military Commission's spies do come through here.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Who the hell are you calling Commission spies?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: We are not your enemies. We've come to end this war.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I've read your file, Sarkaz. 'The Right-Hand of Manfred'. Your word can hardly be taken at face value.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Then maybe you've also read how I escaped from Manfred.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I'm afraid I lacked the patience to read through the files of every insignificant devil.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: We've surrounded the place, sir.
attributes.name: Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: Eliminate these Sarkaz spies.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Search their bodies for intel on the command center. I've had enough of the Sarkaz's tricks.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Hah! So you're not attacking 'cause you're too scared of what's inside?!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Well, if you don't have the guts, we'll do it for you.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Are you sure you want to pick a fight now, W? I can ensure a safe retreat, at least.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: (Pulls weapon) I'm with her. The Sarkaz cannot afford to wait.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Protect Paprika, Ines. We're forcing our way through.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: If you say so.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Shadows spread from Ines's feet, locking on to every Victorian soldier present.
Then, she senses a different kind of shadow.
...Delphine?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Let them through, sir.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And here I was thinking you finally made up your mind to kill us.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: I am not under the command of the Exemplars, my lady. Nor do I want to be put on 'mandatory leave' like Bellingham. I am simply executing the Duke's orders—
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: 'Wipe out the Sarkaz.' No more, no less.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: These Sarkaz share our strategic objective.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They aren't a monolith.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You're here to kill the Nachzehrer, aren't you, Hoederer?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer King holds great significance to the Sarkaz, but he cannot be allowed to live.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Only the swift and complete defeat of his forces will convince the ones sitting on the fence to willingly withdraw with us.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...You want to flee with the devils?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Got a problem with that, punk?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: You do understand the crimes they committed, do you not?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: ...I can't deny them.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: But I also understand what will happen if large numbers of leaderless Sarkaz mercenaries are left scattered across the countryside.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Mercenaries who've tasted blood in war.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You want to protect them.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And prevent further chaos.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Can you give your guarantee?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: No. But she can. Babel can.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hoederer points towards Wiš'adel.
This war has long since lost its last justification for taking lives. It's time to bring it to an end. This has nothing to do with who I was, or who I am now.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Very well. You can go in.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: If Rhodes Island trusts you, then—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You should be careful, Lady Delphine. What you are doing may constitute treason.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I don't need your advice.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Lieutenant Shearer, instruct the Exemplars units to escort this Sarkaz team into the command center.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Inform all alliance units that this order comes directly from Delphine Windermere.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Understood, Lady Windermere.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I hope you will be able to answer for yourself when the Dukes hear about this.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I have even more reason to hate the Sarkaz than most of you, but I don't let it blind myself to the current situation.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Londinium has bled enough.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Thank you for your help.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's not you I'm helping, Sarkaz. Go end this war.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: As for you, sir, you can either continue this staring match with me, or we can both go back with our men and prepare for the next battle.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Or do you need to call the Duke of Caster for instructions?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: No need for that, Lady Delphine. Her Grace has granted me discretion. I agree that this is not our battlefield.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I will, however, report all the facts pertinent to this incident to Her Grace.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Suit yourself.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: While you're at it, send her my regards, and a promise from the Exemplars—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: 'When the horn of the final battle sounds, the Exemplars will be the first to answer.'
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I get that things are messed up at the Commission, but is this really all they have guarding the command center?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: According to Dame Kal'tsit and the Doctor, Rose Riverside has probably paved the way for us.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: What about Manfred and his men? Afraid of getting blown up or something?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: If the General is still... alive, there's only one place he would be—by the Regent's side.
attributes.name: Paprika

attributes.content: We'll have to count on the Doctor's group being able to handle the Regent.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: It's all yours, Wiš'adel.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: And I thought I'd have to fight you for the mic.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Your first broadcast more than did the job. 'Wiš'adel'...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Why so serious all of a sudden? About to spew a bunch of crap I don't understand again?
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: (Shakes head) The name Her Highness gave you holds many meanings.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: If they need to hear a new voice, they'll hear it. Before that, though, I want to set things up.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: We still need the command center to organize the withdrawal. Don't blow it up in a fit of anger.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Blow it up? Of course I wanna blow it up. But there's only one of it, which means I can't try all the different ways I had planned for it.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Don't rush me, Ines. This time, I'm gonna blow it into the sky, so everyone can see it.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: See who we are, and what we want to do.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Listen up, people! Babel's captured the Military Commission's command center.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Those bastards don't know their heads from their asses right now, and nobody's got it in them to help out the crusty old Nachzehrer King.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: So quit wasting time and get those feet moving!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Believe me or not, whatever, just step on the gas and get this over with!
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: Oh, and just saying, don't forget to keep your eyes on the sky.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: My Patriarch, that...
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: The command structure of the Commission has collapsed. Temporary chaos is inevitable... but no matter.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The long oppression may have numbed the Sarkaz, but this war has reignited their hatred.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: A moment of fear or hesitation will not extinguish it.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer King looks up to see a frenzied flame cut open the veil of decay for an instant.
Besides, there will be another to stand up and lead them.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: 'Babel'...
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.text: The first time I saw the Palace of Westhaleg was fifteen years ago, on a fifty-pound bill.
It was the first time I held a wrench in my hands, and the first time I held money I'd earned myself.
I rubbed the bill with my numb and tired hands. The factory door began to close behind me, but I felt as though the door to all of Terra was being opened before my eyes.
A place that seemed so far away, a place where kings once sat, was right there in my hands.

attributes.content: Why'd we stop?
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: The area ahead is completely shrouded in fog. Captain Horn's orders are to halt the advance until we figure what tricks the Nachzehrer are up to in there.
attributes.name: Exemplar

attributes.content: Look at all the pretty patterns on the tiles beneath our feet, though. We're close to the palace.
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Be patient, and grab a proper weapon from camp. The Sarkaz protecting this place are the worst of the worst. A wrench isn't gonna cut it.
attributes.name: Exemplar

attributes.content: This wrench has smashed five Sarkaz skulls just on the way here!
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: I can do it, whether you believe it or not.
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: It's been fifteen years since I felt like this, but now... I feel like I can take that palace, Nachzehrer King be damned.
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Wait... shush.
attributes.name: Exemplar

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Fog. I'll report it in. Find a safe place to hide.
attributes.name: Exemplar

attributes.content: You hear that sound from inside the fog?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: All I hear is the wind. Same sound as when I forgot to shut the gym's windows at night.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: If it's the wind, it's blowing against something! A flag, or clothes!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Tell Vina—
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: In an instant, innumerable tattered rags rush out of the fog, drifting across the sky above the city like a gray-white tide.
There is cloth freshly torn from clothing, and there are banners woven by hatred over the millennia.
They have wrapped generation after generation of Nachzehrer warriors, hiding the rot beneath, but now they fly freely in the sky, inviting all they touch to walk into decay.
Bloody hell, I can't free my leg!
attributes.name: Exemplar

attributes.content: I got you!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Get away from the cloth! I'll cover you!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: They'll corrode any weapons they touch! Melee units, pull back and let the casters deal with them!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: 1st and 3rd Caster Battalions! Volley on my mark!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I can't get rid of them!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The palls are immersed in decay, the shroud drawing in death. Even the formless witchcraft of the Nachzehrer has rules that can be followed.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: But I am unable to decipher this fog...
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: It is neither Arts, nor natural.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Is this some new tactic, Logos?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: They wouldn't wait this long to try a proven tactic.

attributes.content: Perhaps Nezzsalem is changing... or perhaps it's the Nachzehrer themselves that are changing.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: This place will soon be more dangerous than the shroud we stepped into on the battlefield outside the city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The other units must have encountered the same interference. Even sending out a signal is difficult.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This three-hundred meter plaza is enough to delay a thousand men for days.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: We must find Theresis.;Theresis still has Amnannam.
Analyze the shroud, Logos.;How's our comms equipment, Closure?

attributes.content: Already on it.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: Rules are bound to be analyzed. There must be a source for this unusual shroud.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: I'll just need a bit of time.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: If we don't want the Nachzehrer cutting the battlefield to itty-bitty pieces in the fog, turning our offensive into more of a buffet...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We should fill the plaza with repeaters, including those curvy corridors on the sides...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We don't have time to get a bunch more equipment, but luckily, I have a backup plan!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.text: I never told them that I had never killed anyone. I did exterminate a few districts' worth of musbeasts, but never a human.
I never told them that it was not an Arts-imbued pall I wrapped myself in, but rags taken from stolen mops.
After all, I had never met another Nachzehrer in all the years I grew up in the ditches of Londinium, and no one ever taught me the Nachzehrer Arts.
I wrapped myself in mops so the Victorians wouldn't beat me to death. A 'Mop-Head' that killed musbeasts for them deserved to live more than the Sarkaz, at least.

attributes.content: Er, why are you ripping the cloth off of yourselves?
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: Our Patriarch says we need no longer hide the decay.
attributes.name: Nachzehrer Warrior

attributes.content: Sh—Should I rip mine off too, then?
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: Of course, child.
attributes.name: Nachzehrer Warrior

attributes.content: Er... why doesn't it fly away like yours did?
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: Am I missing some Arts?
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: Feel the decay within you returning to the land. Feel the withered life returning to your body.
attributes.name: Nachzehrer Warrior

attributes.content: Then, rejoice.
attributes.name: Nachzehrer Warrior

attributes.content: So, I should rejoice...?
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.text: I beat a Nachzehrer to a pulp.
They said the Nachzehrer could never be truly killed. So I kept swinging my wrench like my life depended on it, even though the one beneath me was no longer moving.
His ugly frame was much frailer than I imagined. I broke it like the fallen branches in the snow under my feet in the winters of my childhood.
They always broke with such a satisfying crack. Was the war answering my courage?
I liked the feeling.

attributes.content: I could. I said I could.
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Who said you can't truly kill a Nachzehrer? This one seems pretty dead to me!
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Careful there! You dinnae want to be near a Nachzehrer corpse long!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer warrior's body quickly collapses, losing all form and color.
An invisible fog takes up the form of the dead, and gently embraces the remains.
It just rots on its own? That quick?
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: If we dinnae get away now, we and that body both'll be Nachzehrer food.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Bloody hell, and there I was, thinking the Nachzehrer weren't such bloody monsters after all...
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: It'll be fine, alright! Where d'you come from? Think about home! All that sun and hay and beer, you know!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I think you'll feel a wee bit better puttin' all this rot out of your mind!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'm from Londinium! All I had at home was sourdough hard enough to smash skulls!
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Aye, that works!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Yeah, works for me!
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Death and decay are defined by silence. I never thought the Sudaram could operate so noisily.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: No longer do the Nachzehrer try to keep their nature in check. They are allowing decay to run unchecked.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.options: Meaning it'll be harder to stop the spread of rot?

attributes.content: A pair of hands cannot stop rushing water.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.options: But they can easily spray the water further.
What if we 'diluted' the rot, Logos?

attributes.content: Hang in there. You'll get better.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: AAAARRRRRGGGGHHHHH!!! DO I LOOK LIKE I'LL GET BETTER TO YOU?!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: A natural effect of rapidly applying healing Arts.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Take this, give it to—argh! Uh—
attributes.name: Forlorn Soldier

attributes.content: —The pain... it's getting better?
attributes.name: Forlorn Soldier

attributes.content: Do not choose the end out of pain, soldier. Endure.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: The pain will stop, in time.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Thank you, Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Forlorn Soldier

attributes.content: Listen to Liz, it'll be alright. In cases of acute Infection, we have to avoid rapid emotional fluctuations. Take a deep breath, and—
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Message from the Doctor, Nearl.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.options: Shining, Nearl, Nightingale, are you in the rear?

attributes.content: We're at the rear camp. Just returned with a bunch of wounded.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.options: How is Nightingale?

attributes.content: Weak, but she refused to abandon the injured to their fates. We'll take care of her.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.options: I need you to pull out of the area, along with everybody in camp.

attributes.content: Doctor, you...
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Let us know if you need any support.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.options: The Nachzehrer shroud won't be easily dispelled with Arts.
We'll divert the fog of decay to nearby areas.
Do your best to ensure that no one's caught in it.

attributes.content: Roger.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: ...The more lives we save, the less decay there is to feed on.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: It's the duty of the Followers, isn't it?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Nearl. Shining. There's no time to rest.
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Liz...
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Liz's blue fowlbeast perches on Shining's shoulder, rubbing against her cheek.
*Sigh* Sometimes I just don't know what to do with you.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Nearl?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Go and save some lives. As for the enemy—
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Leave them to my spear and shield.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: 'Bzzz—bzzzz—'
'Bzzzt—'
Wow, I never knew fog could be so noisy!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: The interference is too strong! Might be easier to yell than get a signal through!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: We can't place the repeaters directly on the ground! The fog eats away at the antennae!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: If we put up a shield...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: No, with interference like this, that'd just block whatever's left of the signal.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What if we carried the repeaters?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: The fog won't eat at the equipment as long as we're still alive, right?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Closure clenches her comms terminal tightly, but she can feel the pain of its metal corners biting into her skin fading away. Her limbs are becoming numb.
The fog clings to all life equally, inviting them to join the procession of decay.
She knows what Fang's suggestion implies. She wants to reject it.
But she does not.
You go. I'll stay here with the base station.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Think, Closure, think! If this fog is from Nachzehrer Arts, then that can't just be meaningless noise.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Identify the pattern, and we can filter it out!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: There it is! It's not noise, it's the voice of the Nachzehrer!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Even if their flesh has decayed, even if their consciousness has long faded, the lifeforce of the Nachzehrer continues to sing in joy as they return to the Cycle.
No idea what you're so happy about, but I'm sick of hearing it!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Lemme see... a little more over here...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: 'Bzzz—bzzzz—'
'Clo—sure—bzzz'
I'm getting a signal! But it's still not enough...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: How about this?
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: That's what I'm talking about! Wait, Misery? How did you...?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I can cut a path through the fog for communications.
attributes.name: Misery

attributes.content: Great! Now we can hear what—
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: 3rd Caster Battalion! Engage the Nachzehrer emerging from behind the lines!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Don't let them cut us off from the Exemplars!
attributes.name: 'The Young Duke'

attributes.content: The weight-bearing structures of the corridors to the sides of the plaza are heavily damaged! They're about to collapse!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Watch out for falling debris!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The whole battlefield...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: ...It's connected.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.text: Now I have killed. A Victorian girl wearing a bright printed scarf on her head.
Her scarf faded and her complexion twisted before my face. She became no different from the musbeasts I killed, only bigger and more hollow.
Her life must have flowed into me. I find myself swinging the greatsword that they gave me, almost as tall as I am.
But I don't feel the ecstasy they spoke of.

attributes.content: AHHH—!
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: Phew—you, you're rotten too.
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: If I don't rot, you will, is that it?
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: Wh—What's that?
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: The massive explosion almost ruptures the young Nachzehrer's eardrums. A massive suit of armor flies past him.
The fog gently picks away the broken limbs the armor is wearing, pale fragments dispersing with the steam.
Several Sudarams fly towards it, their swords making screeching sounds on the metal, piercing the dull thud of Originium explosives.
(Sound of gushing steam)
attributes.name: Steam Knight

attributes.content: Metal... shall... decay...
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: The young Nachzehrer has no time to look back. Heavy metal legs break the fog in front of him, blocking out the already-dim sunlight.
How many years do you think it took us to build The Crawler? You think we'd just let you eat it?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Armor plate to the portside foreleg!
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Does the main gun still turn? Two o'clock, fire!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Blast a path through the Sudaram for the Steam Knight!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: The young Nachzehrer falls to the ground. Cold blood immediately seeps through the remaining mop cloth, as though he was born to wipe such filth.
But why was he born to?
He has no time to think about the answer. A great iron hammer is raised above his head, its glaring reflection in his eyes.
No, no—
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: I don't want to—
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: You don't want to die.
A tide of rot rushes past him, and the hammer falls to the ground as scrap.
M—My Patriarch...?
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: I—I'm sorry, I'm not, I didn't...
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: Please, don't punish me... I'm not a deserter, I just—
attributes.name: 'Mop-Head'

attributes.content: If you have yet to fully comprehend war, then you are no deserter. It is not yours to give up your life so easily in.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Your war has yet to come.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The fog... it's fading.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: More and more wounded are being evacuated before they die. The Nachzehrer are being deprived of the rot they feed on.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: 'Disperse.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: The fog is thinning.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Even I can breathe now.

attributes.content: Wait, you couldn't breathe all this time, Doctor?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Why didn't you say anything?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: It wasn't that bad. It's just better now.

attributes.content: This won't last for long. Shining reports that the fog that had been diverted elsewhere is returning.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We must move—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor—!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Mon3tr!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'Perish.'
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: You feel a sense of deja vu.
It is not that any memories came back to you. It is that, once again, you sense how tiny and frail your life is.
A blade of grass in the wilderness. What is one blade or a thousand in the presence of death? You will all become nutrition for next year's sprouts.
The tide of rot crosses Amiya's black curtain, Mon3tr's massive frame, and Logos's wall of incantations, rushing towards you.
The next instant, it comes to an abrupt halt.

attributes.content: It is you.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.options: It is me.;What?

attributes.content: You have kept your promise.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Mon3tr, Structural Fortification! Protect the Doctor!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There is no need, Dame. I shall not fight you here.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Even though this is a battlefield?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Precisely because it is a battlefield.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: You do not belong to this battlefield of mine. Every second you spend here is an insult to it.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.options: War doesn't belong to anyone. It only destroys everyone.

attributes.content: Hah! How arrogant.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: No matter. This war that has nurtured me, this war I have nurtured, is now over.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Even if it has cycled back and forth for a thousand years in the most uninteresting manner, even if the pain it gave rise to has become numbness, this war has achieved its goal.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Now, the Sarkaz are masters of their own destiny.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Amnannam in Theresis's hands...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Theresis? No. The Amnannam is in the hands of all Sarkaz, scattered across the land for a thousand years.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: From this war, they will come away with power, freedom, and a future.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: What is left for me is the purest afterglow of war, one that knows no purpose but war itself.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: If there is no purpose, then why do you—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Outblood child, so eager to put a stop to everything you do not wish to see.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: If you see war as only evil, suffering as only a mistake, and sacrifice as only a waste, then you can bring neither destruction nor rebirth.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: ...Should I take this as the God of War advising the King of Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Very good! Finally, you call yourself king.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: But it is not advice. My war may have won the Sarkaz a future, but it is not my place to dictate what it is.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: My place is only to fulfill the very nature of my being.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.options: To spread decay?;To nurture new life?

attributes.content: To me, decay and rebirth are one and the same.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: As for you, ageless dame, outblood king, and you... It is not my place to judge you.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Go. Theresis awaits.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Behind the Nachzehrer King, the ranks of Sarkaz part silently.
They reveal a black path between white shroud, white bones, and white pall.
...Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Only by taking down Theresis and Amnannam...;...will we truly bring an end to this calamity.

attributes.content: We're with you, Doctor.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: This is the moment Rhodes Island has prepared for. There is no need to hesitate.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: And... the Nachzehrer King?

attributes.content: My whistle shall disperse the fog.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.content: If we triumph, we will not celebrate victory alone.
attributes.name: Logos

attributes.text: Through the fog, you can see the faint silhouette of a tank, the gushing steam of a Steam Knight, Exemplars and alliance soldiers fighting side-by-side—
You hear the communications of Closure, Wiš'adel, and the others—
All of them fighting for the same end...

attributes.options: —An end to this war.
Let's go meet Theresis.

attributes.content: You have crossed the waters of death, Aefanyl, and witnessed the dim candlelight of the other side.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Go. I do not wish to fight you.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Sing once more when all decay has returned to the soil, when all war drums are silent.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Your end does not lie here.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Banshee shakes his head and says nothing. His bone pen floats up in front of him.
Hah. So be it.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: ...I do envy Laqeramaline.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer King spreads his arms wide. The Banshee begins to move his bone pen.
A thousand branches rise from the Nachzehrer, formed of flesh, blood, and bone. A thousand incantations are etched by the point of the Banshee's pen, in opposition to the decay.

A thousand branches spread out on the battlefield. Every Nachzehrer corpse they touch, from the ethereal remains of the ancient Sudaram, to the yet-unrotted flesh of young Nachzehrer warriors, blooms in flowers of decay.
Once again, the Nachzehrer rise from decay.
Once again, the fearless charge forth in the incantations of the Banshee.

attributes.text: The Palace of Westhaleg... It wasn't grand at all.
In fact, it looks even more decrepit than what I saw on that bill fifteen years ago.
The blood and flesh covering my hands feels more real. I stopped counting the number of Sarkaz I put down. It must've been a lot, because my wrench broke.

attributes.content: I see him! That must be the Nachzehrer King!
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Wait... This is as far as I can go.
attributes.name: Exemplar

attributes.content: *Cough* You can't charge in bare-handed. Take this sword.
attributes.name: Exemplar

attributes.content: Th—The Sighs of Kings—
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.text: My daughter liked to rub my arm when I was lying face-down on the bed. She said it was fun because my muscles were so hard.
I would pat her shoulder and tell her she could become just as strong, strong enough to lift a whole pile of steel bars.
Holding the sword in my hand, I stab at the mountain of branches under me, and climb it.

attributes.content: But how do I reach an enemy floating in mid-air?
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: (Quick puff of steam)
attributes.name: Steam Knight

attributes.content: For Victoria!!!
attributes.name: Steam Knight

attributes.text: I see the Steam Knight charge towards death.
I hear a sharp whistle in my ear.
I feel the ground tremble from the guns of the tank...
The elusive, terrifying white figure in the sky stops for an instant. Then the Steam Knight dives from the sky, sending the Nachzehrer King crashing to the ground.

attributes.content: He... He's so close...
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.text: I am beginning to fall in love with war—I leap from the mountain of branches, and put the sword through the Nachzehrer King.
I can even feel my eyes burn at the heat gushing from the Steam Knight as it breathes.

attributes.content: *Pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: 'Big Wrench'

attributes.content: Victorian... you have learned to draw life from war.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Now, you must learn to return it to war.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.text: Hah. It was no use at all.
I am thrown a great distance. I can no longer feel my own body.
I see the Nachzehrer King once again rise into the sky, the Steam Knight wrapped in a frenzy of white cloth...
The strange Sarkaz casting his Arts, cutting a path towards the Nachzehrer King...
Familiar faces treading the death-filled path, towards that seemingly insurmountable foe with no hint of hesitation—
The fog seems to be dispersing. I see the massive four-legged tank advance... Why is there a golden-haired Kuranta here?
What are those strange contraptions that have appeared on the battlefield, making a strange sound?
I see Her Highness, our hero, Vina Victoria, the returned king, leading more and more people forward...
'For Victoria!'
I seem to see the end of the war.
The Nachzehrer King's silhouette overlaps with the sun. It is bright. Before him gathers those eager to end the war—
I can no longer see what happens next... where did the sword go?
Sorry, my girl... your daddy's not coming home.

attributes.content: <p=1>Soul Furnace of Kazdel</><p=2>Eve of the Babel Exodus, 1086</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: So you've chosen to answer Theresis's call to arms.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Even though the war will destroy you...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Has your crown shown you my end, Your Highness?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: No. We simply understand full well that the only end of war is destruction.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What is there to fear in destruction?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The first Nachzehrer learned our purpose when he rose from the ashes of war.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: 'I am the end of all things.'
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The great boulder of war sits above our heads on the slopes of time. All we can do is push it with all our might.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: This time, however, Theresis has promised me an end to the cycle.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: As had you. Do you remember?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: I do, at the founding of the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But we have found another path.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Then prove it to me, Your Highness. I will wait.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Even if you do not find your end, however, I will carve out another path for the Sarkaz—
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: I can see your emotions. You are excited about this path.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I have waited too long, since that war two hundred years ago.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Farewell, Your Highness. I will witness the conclusion of your dispute with the Regent.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: ...Babel will return.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I have never doubted it. Nor have I doubted your promise.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Farewell.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The rays of dawn shine from the pinnacle of the Palace of Westhaleg.
They drive away the fog, revealing the aftermath of battle.
The fog is gone.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: So is the Nachzehrer King.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Did we win? He's dead, right?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: ...Innit?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I still sense that suffocating presence.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: ...We'll need to get used to it. There is much to be done.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The daybreak was unfamiliar to those returning home, or to those on the battlefield.
Morning rays pour down like blood, over the carpet of bodies on the ground.
Is this what the sunrise always looked like in Londinium?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: No... never.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The cold dawn pours blood toward the skyline, toward the winding mountains in the distance, like an ocean of blood.
The few cries of joy from the crowd quickly fall silent. This is not how anyone imagined the glory of victory.
It's over.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: But who can truly kill war?
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: No one can kill war.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Do you still sense his presence, Your Highness?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: He has unfortunately given himself to death. But you are correct. War will never end.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: He merely left because this particular war is over.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I almost envy him.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: He has taken so many people along with him, all to enjoy a war that belonged only to him.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I have lost another fine opponent.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Tch. Guess the old man really is dead.
attributes.name: Wiš'adel

attributes.content: No time to mull over it. The Victorians could begin their purge at any moment.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: There's a lot on your mind.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: There's just something I'm not sure about.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I have this feeling that, when the next war to change the history of Terra comes—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: No, I'm probably overthinking it.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: In the silence, only the lonely sound of a bone whistle reaches the pitch-black underground throne room.
It is the Banshee's elegy for the dead.
Is the Regent gone?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...Did you hear it? What is your true plan?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: There is no answer. The Regent of Kazdel, the one who began this war, is not here.
He closes his eyes and seems to see a river of blood flowing towards the sky.
Manfred cannot even tell what became of the Sarkaz hero who left so many legends behind.
But he sees an image in his mind's eye—
When the fires of war once again ravage Kazdel, death shall emerge from the mountains on the skyline.
